image.altText: A submersible vessel is seen underwater, attached to a larger platform

items.synopsis: US Coast Guard authorities confirm the destruction of the missing Titan submersible, announcing a "debris field" was found near the Titanic wreck. Follow live.

title.children: Coast Guard says debris field points to 'catastrophic' loss of pressure in missing submersible

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: An ROV has discovered the tailcone of the Titan submersible, John Mauger, the First Coast Guard District commander says. Additional debris has also been discovered "The debris is consistent with the catastrophic loss of the pressure chamber," he says.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Debris found near Titanic site

children.content: An ROV has discovered the tailcone of the Titan submersible, John Mauger,
the First Coast Guard District commander says.
Additional debris has also been discovered
"The debris is consistent with the catastrophic loss of the pressure chamber," he says.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Oceangate, the company that launched the submersible missing near the Titanic wreck off the coast of North America, says it believes all on board have perished. In a statement, the company says it’s a sad time for the entire explorer community and for the family members of those lost at sea. A remote-operated vehicle searching for the missing submersible discovered a debris field just hours after it was deployed to the sea floor on Thursday local time.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Submersible crew believed dead, OceanGate says

children.content: Oceangate, the company that launched the submersible missing near the Titanic wreck off the coast of North America, says it believes all on board have perished.
In a statement, the company says it’s a sad time for the entire explorer community and for the family members of those lost at sea.
A remote-operated vehicle searching for the missing submersible discovered a debris field just hours after it was deployed to the sea floor on Thursday local time.

image.altText: A small submarine appearing to dive downwards into the ocean.

items.synopsis: The Coast Guard says a "catastrophic implosion" likely occurred, killing all five people on board the Titan submersible that was lost during a voyage to the Titanic.

title.children: OceanGate says five passengers on missing Titanic submersible died

image.altText: An illustration shows the wreck of the Titanic on the sea floor, and a small submersible, the Titan, in the depths of the ocean.

items.synopsis: Take a 3,800-metre journey to learn what's so dangerous about exploring the deep seas.

title.children: See how the pressure and danger build the further you dive towards the Titanic

image.altText: Jessica wears a shirt that says Vegan Grocer and stands with her hands on her hips behind a counter loaded with chocolates

items.synopsis: Australia may not be hearing the full story about the impact of rising interest rates on small businesses, as a "perfect storm" of pressures contributes to a gloomy outlook.

title.children: Businesses fear there is a growing, hidden toll of rate rises

image.altText: Cars and tow trucks from aerial view.

items.synopsis: Victoria Police have been pursuing two young males through Melbourne's CBD, alleged to have been involved in multiple carjackings and an aggravated burglary.

title.children: Police continue Melbourne manhunt for alleged carjackers who remain armed and on the run

image.altText: Albanese stands speaking to media from a courtyard.

items.synopsis: This week the Joint Standing Committee on Electoral Matters recommended broad reforms: a drastic lowering of the threshold for disclosing donations.

title.children: Labor's 'Godfather' seeks deal on electoral reform — but the devil is in the detail

image.altText: Meghan and Harry applauding

items.synopsis: Just months after Meghan Markle's podcast debuted at the top of Spotify's charts, her lucrative deal with the audio giant has collapsed. Here's what may have gone wrong.

title.children: How a rumoured 'lack of productivity' and a huge shift at Spotify ended Harry and Meghan's podcast deal

image.altText: Crystal blue waters and a pristine sandy beach next to a cluster of lush green trees.

items.synopsis: Tonga looks set to become the first Pacific country to experiment with wave technology when work commences on a power wave park later this year.

title.children: Could wave energy technology solve Tonga's crippling electricity costs?

image.altText: Interior of a house being worked on.

items.synopsis: Before buying her first home, Anna Jug wanted to exercise her right to have it inspected. It was one of the reasons she missed out on the sale.

title.children: 'We have had houses that were built illegally': Calls for better protections for home buyers in Tasmania

image.altText: A man looks at the camera

items.synopsis: Farhan Khalaf fled Iraq for southern Queensland in 2019. He's concerned his community will be isolated after federal government funding cuts.

title.children: Refugees who fled ISIS worried after funding cut to support services

image.altText: Feet in bed with sad faces drawn on them.

items.synopsis: While dyspareunia, or painful sex, is very treatable, health professionals say stigma around sex and pleasure and a tendency to think that pain is normal is preventing people from seeking help.

title.children: 'Huge impact on self-esteem': Some Australians are having painful sex for years. But it doesn't have to be that way

image.altText: Australia's Ellyse Perry stands on one leg after whipping the ball away on the leg-side as a fielder watches in the background.

items.synopsis: The Women's Ashes series gets underway with Australia batting first against England at Trent Bridge in the one-off Test. Check out the live scores and stats in our ScoreCentre.

title.children: Women's Ashes live: Australia batting on day one of one-off Test at Trent Bridge to start series

image.altText: a man in glasses with a bald head in a suit delivers a speech to parliament.

items.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton warns the federal government it should abandon the Voice referendum if it is unconvinced the "yes" campaign will succeed.

title.children: Dutton calls for Voice referendum to be abandoned if government isn't confident of success

image.altText: Hands holding a cervical cancer self-collection tool, showing the swab and container

items.synopsis: A majority of cervical cancers occur in women who have never been screened. More of them, including disadvantaged and regional women, are now taking the test thanks to a new method.

title.children: How a DIY cancer test is saving lives and affording patients more privacy

image.altText: Businessman Yevgeny Prigozhin, left, stands next to Vladimir Putin and other men.

items.synopsis: As Russia moves to take control of Wagner with its push for recruits to sign contracts before July 1, Yevgeny Prigozhin, the head of the mercenary group, has vowed a boycott. Now everyone is waiting to see if he will ultimately bend to the Russian leader's will — and what happens if he refuses.

title.children: Putin appears to be feuding with his only friend. But nothing inside the Kremlin is as it seems

image.altText: A Geelong AFL player lies on a mobile stretcher with a neckbrace and a trainer supporting his head.

items.synopsis: Geelong star Jeremy Cameron is taken to hospital after a collision with teammate Gary Rohan - but Rohan puts his distress aside to be the match-winner for the Cats over the Demons at Kardinia Park.

title.children: Rollercoaster for Rohan as Gary wins game for Geelong after shocking collision with Jeremy Cameron

image.altText: Tom Roper is dressed in a checked shirt and jacket as he sits in his wheelchair in front of a tram.

items.synopsis: The giant of the Victorian Labor Party, who served as a minister in the Cain and Kirner governments, is being remembered as a fierce social justice advocate, a hard worker, a reformer, an early campaigner for climate action, a mentor and a top bloke.

title.children: Long-serving Victorian Labor MP 'Snappy' Tom Roper dies aged 78

image.altText: A group of rugby league players look sad after losing a match

items.synopsis: Brilliant finishes, experience trumping youth and some big gambles that did not pay off defined the second women's State of Origin match. Here are five key points from New South Wales' 18-14 victory.

title.children: Five quick hits — the victors cry and the vanquished dance as New South Wales win the battle but lose the war

image.altText: An elderly man in glasses sits in front of a blank wall.

items.synopsis: Gerald Ridsdale appeared via video link from St John's Hospital at Port Phillip Prison, appearing very frail and significantly weaker than the last time he appeared in front of the court.

title.children: Fresh charge and guilty plea from one of Australia's most prolific paedophile priests

image.altText: A head shot of a man in police uniform

items.synopsis: Australian Federal Police commissioner Reece Kershaw was directly involved in meetings with PwC partner Mick Fuller, the former NSW police chief, to discuss a $750,000 contract awarded without a tender.

title.children: AFP commissioner accused of failing to declare conflict of interest after meetings with PwC 'friend'

image.altText: A woman wearing a black tracksuit stands at the entrance to a retail store.

items.synopsis: She says the thefts range from someone slipping pencils into their pocket to people walking off with a trolley filled with $500 in decorations.

title.children: Thieves are stealing from Michelle's store every single day, as shoplifting bounces back in NSW

image.altText: A composite image of Peter Genders and Janet with photos of building defects in the background.

items.synopsis: It's the biggest investment most people make, but in the "buyer beware" market, what you see is not always what you get, as these people found out.

title.children: Most of the buildings on Janet's new property are illegal. She says she didn't know

image.altText: Offender anklet monitor on offender's ankle

items.synopsis: About 3,163 sex offenders were required to report to police across the state last year – a figure authorities say increases by at least 100 every year.

title.children: Queensland Police struggling to monitor rising number of sex offenders, report suggests

image.altText: A white submersible vessel floating on a platform on water.

items.synopsis: A few days after a submersible with five people aboard has gone missing, a Canadian surveillance vessel has detected underwater noises, more narrowly defining the search area for rescue crews. But the question remains whether the noises came from the tourist submarine.

title.children: How likely is it that the noises detected underwater are coming from inside the missing Titanic tourist submersible?

image.altText: Julian Sands

items.synopsis: The eighth search for missing actor Julian Sands on Southern California's massive Mount Baldy has been unsuccessful.

title.children: New search for actor Julian Sands unsuccessful as family remembers 'bright memories'

image.altText: picture of firefighters in action

items.synopsis: Cooking gas causes a massive explosion at a barbecue restaurant in north-west China, killing 31 people and injuring seven others during national celebrations on the eve of a long-weekend holiday.

title.children: Thirty-one dead in Chinese barbeque restaurant explosion

image.altText: An astronaut in space above Earth

items.synopsis: New research shows travelling in space dials down the activity of genes in white blood cells that are crucial to the immune system.

title.children: Study reveals how immune system of astronauts breaks down

image.altText: The outside of a large building with a sign that says Auckland City Hospital.

items.synopsis: An algorithm that takes into account factors including a patient's ethnicity to help determine where they should be placed on a surgery waitlist sparks debate in New Zealand.

title.children: New Zealand debates whether ethnicity should be a factor for surgery waitlists

image.altText: A composite picture of two men, the first one is skulling a beer, the second is smiling.

items.synopsis: Jake Brown and Andrew Price will be eligible for parole in less than three years.

title.children: Andrew Price and Jake Brown given seven-year sentences over killing of Jarrad Lovison

image.altText: A bunch of gold bars and coins.

items.synopsis: The investigation will probe whether Australia's reputation in the precious metals industry was damaged by a string of ongoing sagas at the embattled mint.

title.children: Perth Mint to undergo federal probe in wake of so-called 'gold doping' saga

image.altText: A man wearing a black shirt and glasses.

items.synopsis: William Kamm, who refers to himself as "Little Pebble" and founded a notorious doomsday cult on the NSW South Coast, applies for bail in the Supreme Court.

title.children: Paedophile cult leader faces court over alleged breach of supervision orders

image.altText: Nurses and doctor pictured during medical procedure, generic image.

items.synopsis: Nurses hired during the pandemic now stand to lose their jobs with no money set aside to cover their temporary contracts past mid-2025, and the NSW Labor government yet to commit to keeping the positions.

title.children: Over 1,100 nursing jobs face the axe as money runs out
